Ad Text:
Take hold of a monster opportunity and join our Business Risk Management team as a Risk Manager Governance Insights.  If you’re a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane or Sydney, we’d love you to apply. 

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We’re all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. We’re looking for a manager to support building and embedding a contemporary Line 1 risk governance, reporting and insights function within our Business Risk Management team. You’ll support the establishment of the strategy, be part of a high‑performing team, and partner with senior leaders across the enterprise to uplift risk maturity and drive consistent practices aligned to ART’s Risk Management Framework.

 

Day to day, you'll:

Support the Risk Governance team’s strategy and operating model;
Ensure effective risk forums and rhythms are in place across the enterprise; coordinate Line 1 risk reporting for executive and board forums; identify enterprise‑wide insights and priorities.
Lead the annual Trustee Risk Management Declaration and support risk appetite metric assessment and reporting.
Participate to the maintenance of a Line 1 risk community of practice across the enterprise and lift risk capability across the business.
Design and implement Line 1 risk reporting and analytics frameworks; leverage AI and emerging tech to deliver efficient, decision‑ready insights.
Partner with the business, their line 1 risk managers, Line 2 and Line 3 to embed robust risk culture and practices and contribute to board‑level reporting.

This role is a permanent opportunity. 

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:  

Tertiary qualifications in Risk, Business, Law or related discipline.
Deep knowledge of enterprise/operational risk and compliance within superannuation/insurance‑in‑super, including APRA prudential standards.
Strong Line 1 and/or Line 2 experience across governance, control frameworks, incident management, analytics and Board reporting.
Strong experience within the Financial Services industry, especially within Superannuation industry
Proven team leadership and change capability; able to operate at pace amid ambiguity while balancing BAU, future design and transformation.

About us

Our 2.4 million members trust us to take care of over $330 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you’ll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now

Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close Tuesday, 10 March 2026. 

We don’t want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you’ll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you’ve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us – and recruitment is no different.

Job Title: Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Business Partner
Ad Text:
Location - Sydney or Brisbane, Australia
Work Arrangement - Hybrid




The Senior FP&A Business Partner is a critical role within the FP&A CoE, providing end‑to‑end financial planning, consolidation, and performance insight to support effective decision‑making across the business. The role plays a central part in end‑of‑month performance management, budgeting, forecasting, and long‑range planning, pulling together financial results, operational inputs, and key drivers into a coherent, decision‑ready view for senior leadership. The role partners closely with various areas across the business to ensure alignment between actual performance, forecasts, and strategic plans. 




The role plays a critical part in driving performance excellence, leveraging continuous improvement (LEAN) principles, SAP S/4HANA, automation, and effective change management to improve recovery accuracy, reduce leakage, and enhance end‑to‑end process efficiency. The role also works closely with offshore shared service centres to standardise processes, improve data quality, and enable scalable, efficient operations.







What we do at Weir
We are a global leader in mining technology for a sustainable future. We help our customers extract the resources the world needs more efficiently and more sustainably. Our planet’s future depends on the transition to renewable energy, and that transition can only happen with the metals and minerals our customers deliver. So, we work side by side with mines across the globe to move less rock, use less energy, use water wisely, and create less waste. Together, we drive the shift to smart, efficient, and more sustainable mining.




Make your impact
You’ll play a key role in solving real-world challenges. You’ll apply your skills to deliver results that matter whether that’s through engineering, planning or customer support. You’ll work with purpose, learn every day and help shape a more sustainable future.







What you’ll do

Performance Management: Own and coordinate the FP&A contribution to month-end close, consolidating financial results, flash reporting, and performance analysis to provide a clear, decision-ready view for senior leadership.

Business Partnering: Act as a trusted FP&A partner to senior business and finance stakeholders, with a strong focus on business partnering to ensure alignment between actual performance, forecasts, and strategic plans.

Budgeting & Forecasting: Lead the coordination and consolidation of budgets, forecasts, and long-range plans, developing driver-based models linking operational activity to financial outcomes, challenging assumptions to ensure robust and transparent plans.

Reporting & Insights: Provide clear, decision-oriented insights by translating financial results, forecasts, and trends into actionable narratives; review and improve management and executive reporting for relevance and alignment with key value drivers.

Continuous Improvement: Apply LEAN principles and automation to streamline FP&A processes, improve recovery accuracy, reduce leakage, and enhance end-to-end process efficiency.

Systems & Governance: Serve as a key FP&A SME for planning and reporting tools including SAP S/4HANA; ensure strong data governance, reconciliation, and control across planning and reporting cycles.

Safety First: Demonstrate 100% commitment to our zero harm behaviors in support of our drive towards developing a world-class safety culture.







What you’ll bring


Must-haves:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, economics, or business

Strong experience in FP&A, financial planning, or management reporting in a complex environment

Proven expertise in budgeting, forecasting, consolidation, and performance analysis

Strong working knowledge of SAP S/4HANA and FP&A/reporting tools




Nice-to-haves:




Professional qualification (CA, CPA, or CIMA)

Experience applying continuous improvement (LEAN) and automation in finance processes

Excellent communication and storytelling skills

Ability to influence senior stakeholders and operate effectively in a matrix environment







Why join Weir?


We live our values we think safety first, do the right thing, respect each other, aim high, and delight our customers. We encourage our people to lead by example and celebrate our successes.


We’re passionate about our purpose to help deliver the natural resources that are essential to create a better future for the world. We do this by combining our deep customer insights, world-class engineering, materials science expertise, and intelligent automation to deliver innovative end-to-end solutions incorporating our signature technologies.


We believe your voice matters and your ideas make a difference. We’re working hard to nurture a diverse culture where our people feel like they belong and can do the best work of their lives. You can help shape our unique culture through our inclusion networks and safety initiatives.







Benefits

Competitive pay

Career development and learning support

Access to global inclusion networks

Regional and team-specific benefits

Sharebuilder scheme

Wellness support for you and your family

Collaboration with global teams

Study support

Company description:



About Brisbane Catholic Education
Brisbane Catholic Education (BCE) is a vibrant learning community within the Archdiocese, employing over 12,000 people across a diverse range of positions. As the largest provider of Catholic education in Queensland, BCE is dedicated to delivering high-quality education from Prep to Year 12. Through strong partnerships with parents, governments, and the wider community, BCE fosters social responsibility, self-discipline and Catholic values in all its students. We offer a supportive working culture where care for the individual is an important part of our ethos. Arrive at work every day to a welcoming and compassionate environment, knowing that you'll be supported to take care of what's important to you. Learn more about Brisbane Catholic Education.



Job description:



Summary

As Senior Advisor Strategy, you will play a key role in shaping system‑wide priorities and decision‑making across Brisbane Catholic Education. Working closely with the Strategy Lead, you'll deliver high‑quality strategic analysis, insights and recommendations that influence policy, enterprise priorities and organisational performance. This role is ideal for a strategic thinker who enjoys tackling complex issues, working across diverse stakeholders and translating evidence into clear, practical direction.

Location: BCEO Woolloongabba
Work hours: Fulltime | Flexible Working Arrangements Available
Status: Permanent (Continuing) | Commencing March 2026
Salary: $137,560 - $152,836 plus super
Ad Close date: 09 March 2026
Contact: CareersBCE@bne.catholic.edu.au ​ 
About the opportunity

In this position you will:  

Provide high‑level strategic advice and lead initiatives that influence organisational direction, policy and practice
Analyse complex data and insights to challenge thinking, identify opportunities and support continuous improvement
Support functional teams to evaluate options and determine organisational and operational requirements
Develop strategies, frameworks and recommendations to enhance system performance and educational outcomes
Prepare high‑quality reports, briefs and committee papers on significant strategy, planning and research initiatives
Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to deliver shared outcomes
Partner with BCE office and school‑based leaders to support enterprise priorities
Build capability across teams to improve effectiveness, efficiency and impact 
About you

To be successful in this position you will bring relevant contemporary skills and experience including:   

Strong experience in strategic analysis, policy development or advisory roles within complex organisations
The ability to synthesise data, research and insights into clear, evidence‑based recommendations
Well‑developed stakeholder engagement skills, with the confidence to influence and collaborate across functions
Experience preparing high‑level reports and advice for senior leaders or governance forums
A proactive, solutions‑focused mindset with the ability to manage competing priorities
Tertiary qualifications in Business Management, Economics or a related discipline (highly regarded but not essential), or equivalent experience 

Eligibility and Safeguarding requirements: 

Eligibility to work in Australia for the duration of the appointment.
Ability to obtain a National Criminal History check prior to commencement.  
Why choose BCE

Join us and be part of the largest Catholic Diocese in Queensland, nurturing your personal and professional development goals. As a valued member of our organisation, enjoy these and other rewards:

Opportunities for career advancement and professional development
Competitive remuneration and flexible work arrangements (position dependent)
Access to targeted AI tools and training with a focus on innovation and strong ethical standards. Learn more here: The Rome Call for AI Ethics and Microsoft Australia News Centre
Salary packaging and salary-sacrificing options
Active staff social club and wellness programs
Personal support for our employees and families through the Employee Assistance Program.
Fitness Passport access - discounted membership giving you flexible access to a wide network of gyms, pools and fitness facilities for you and your family.

Please note applications for this position may be considered as they are received, and an appointment made prior to the advertised close date.

Everyone at BCE models and fosters a commitment to the safeguarding of children and promotes a culture where student protection is everyone's responsibility. The Archdiocese of Brisbane has standards of conduct for workers to maintain a safe and healthy environment for children. Our commitment to these standards requires that we conduct working with children checks and background referencing for all persons who will engage in direct and regular involvement with children and young people and/or adults-at-risk. The organisation is fully committed to child safety and has a zero tolerance to abuse of children or adults-at-risk.

Equity and inclusion are at the core of our Catholic values and we recognise the benefits of a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this position.

By choosing to continue, you agree to the Privacy Policy (Employment Collection Notice which includes being contacted by Brisbane Catholic Education in future if a similar position becomes available) and to be included in BCE's talent pools for future opportunities. Show Privacy Policy

A leading commercial property advisory business is seeking a Senior Analyst to support high-value retail investment transactions across Australia. Working closely with senior Partners, this role blends financial analysis, research, client engagement and marketing support ideal for someone commercially sharp who enjoys both analytical work and front-end deal exposure.

This is a career-building opportunity offering exposure to institutional-grade retail assets including shopping centres, supermarkets and large-format retail investments.

The Opportunity

You’ll play a key role supporting transaction activity, preparing investment analysis, developing marketing collateral and assisting Partners in securing new business opportunities. The role offers strong client exposure and involvement in property inspections, buyer engagement and deal support.

Key Responsibilities
Financial analysis, due diligence and cashflow modelling for retail assets
Prepare institutional-grade marketing materials and sales reporting
Research market trends, economic drivers and investment insights
Support client engagement, inspections and transaction processes
Assist Partners with business development, submissions and reporting
About You
Experience in commercial property, investment analysis or advisory
Strong financial modelling, research and analytical capability
Excellent written communication and presentation skills
Commercially minded with strong attention to detail
Proactive, curious and confident working in a fast-paced environment
What’s on Offer
Exposure to major retail investment transactions nationally
Direct mentorship from senior industry leaders
Strong career progression and development opportunity
Collaborative, high-performing team environment

For a confidential discussion please contact Caitie on 0421 827 803 OR cwoods@woodsco.com.au

Woods & Co Recruitment is committed to creating a positively diverse and inclusive workforce which values all backgrounds and experiences. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, members of the LGBTQI+ community and people with disability.
